answers.text: Greeks, Kushans, Scythians, Turks, and Afghans
son of Taksh the son Bharat who was the brother of Ram

qas.question: What is said to be the world's oldest university?
What empire was Taxila a center of learning of?

plausible_answers.text: the Greeks, Kushans, Scythians, Turks, and Afghans

qas.question: What was the centre of learning in the Greek Empire?
Who was the brother of Taksh?

context: Due to its location, the Punjab region came under constant attacks and influence from the west and witnessed centuries of foreign invasions by <b5_0>the <a0_0>Greeks, Kushans, Scythians, Turks, and Afghans<b5_0/><a0_0/>. <b6_0>The city of Taxila<b6_0/>, founded by <a1_0>son of Taksh the son Bharat who was the brother of <b9_0>Ram<b9_0/><a1_0/>. It was reputed to house the oldest university in the world,[citation needed] <a2_0>Takshashila University<a2_0/>. One of the teachers was the <a4_0>great Vedic thinker and politician<a4_0/> <b7_0>Chanakya<b7_0/>. <b8_0>Taxila<b8_0/> was a great centre of learning and intellectual discussion during <a3_0>the Maurya Empire<a3_0/>. It is a UN World Heritage site, valued for its archaeological and religious history.
